result.execSummary:
All charges against Donald Wayne Sexton in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald Wayne Sexton is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Wayne Sexton

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on July 20, 2022 at 11:45 am.

3:46 PM Defendant Donald Wayne Sexton appeared by video.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Garrett M. Gondik appeared by video for Donald Wayne Sexton. 
Court notes motion to reconsider
Att Gondik- no resolution
State agrees
Att Gondik- Court had ruled the motion to dismiss was waived as untimely filed, was filed prior to prelim, requests motions not be ruled denied.
Court notes motion doesn't have to be heard before prelim, just filed.
Att Gondik- Local practice has been to hear motion before prelim. Believes complaint was defective, Information should be amended to clarify which statute client is being charged under.
State requests motions be denied as untimely, filed brief stating position
Court- doesn't understand issue. If motions filed just before prelim they couldn't be heard but they can be heard after prelim.
State points out focus is on charging language. If entire complaint is read it's clear all incidents charged were intentional, not neglectful .
Court- easiest solution is to amend information to state "intentionally"
State agrees
Att Gondik responds- charging documentr should state intent.
Court finds motions were not waived, but no effect on prelim. State can charge as many counts as they like on the information, they just have to show probable cause for one at prelim. Grants motion to reconsider. 
Att Gondik requests charges be clarified
Court notes charging a count under intent doesn't preclude charging another under neglect or recklessness
State requests arraignment be adjourned, will clean up information to show intent as basis for charges.
Court sets new date
Arraignment scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Order to dismiss.
Arraignment on June 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Transcript of Preliminary Hearing on May 18, 2022
Motion hearing on June 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
No in person contact with Victim.

9:13 AM Defendant Donald Wayne Sexton in court.  Attorney Richard S Gondik Jr in court for Donald Wayne Sexton.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Gondik filed 3 motions this morning, at 9:28. Court indicates motions are waived. Not timely filed. Gondik indicates complaint is defective, soonest they could file these motions. State has not even read the motions yet. Ready to proceed today with evidence. Not prepared to deal with motions today. Fine with adjourning prelims if court needs. Court indicates court can't adequately hear motions with such short notice and finds them waived. Will proceed with preliminary hearings today. 
Court calls case. State calls witness, Christopher Moe, Detective Superior Police Department, S/T. State-direct examination of witness. March 11, 2022, City of Superior, Douglas County, Wisconsin. Objection, best evidence, sustained. Continued questioning. Objection again, overruled. Witness identifies Defendant. Court notes identification of witness. Objection, foundation, sustained. Continued questioning.  Objection, non responsive. Question rephrased. Objection, leading, overruled. No additional questions. Attorney cross examines witness. Objection, relevance, sustained. No further questions. State redirects. Court questions relevance. Question withdrawn. Attorney Gondik questions, Objection, relevance, overruled.
State rests.
State makes argument for bind over. Attorney makes argument in opposition. Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Arraignment. Court will obtained arraignment dates from Judge Anderson and send out notice. 
Gondik asks for amendment of bond conditions regarding contact with child. State does not oppose. Bond conditions amended to no in person contact with Victim. 
Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms they have received date and time of hearing and confirms they will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Preliminary hearing on May 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:26 AM Defendant Donald Wayne Sexton in court.  Attorney Richard S Gondik Jr in court for Donald Wayne Sexton. Angela Wilson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Gondik indicates they wish to waive time limits for preliminary hearing and set this case with the other preliminary hearing next week. Spoke with DA Fruehauf and he had no objection to rescheduling.
ADA Wilson has no objection.
Court accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing and re sets it for 4/6/22 at 10:00.  Believes it is in the interest of judicial economy to schedule with companion case.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

03:13 PM Defendant Donald Wayne Sexton in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions alternate address
Defendant-Will live with friend Jamison Armstrong
Att Craker rec. complaint, requests prelim.
State requests $750 cash bail, no contact with victim 1 or address except for 1 time with law enforcement for property retrieval. No prior history or FTA's
Att Craker- Requests signature bond, makes argument
Court questions defendant
Def- 6 year resident, employed.
Court- $5000 signature bond, no contact with victim 1 or residence except 1 time with law enforcement for property retrieval, let Clerk know current address within 24 hours. Questions attorney intentions
Defendant-Will get attorney. Gives financial information. 
Court- doesn't believe he would qualify for public defender. sets date.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
State- gives current address as per his friend
